comments: The subject was a hard subject for me. Taking a math class online isn\'t always the best choice. I struggled with several chapters and probably should have gotten a tutor. Christina Weston is a fair teacher, you know exactly what is expected and assignments are easy to understand. Test are straight forward and study guides are provided.

comments: Worst professor Ive ever had. Very rude and unhelpful. Answer format in math lab is completely inconsistent. Discussions are pointless but still required. Amount of hw is ridiculous. Dont take this professor.

comments: Ms. Weston is an awesome professor and is probably your best option for College Algebra. Her lecutures are very clear and she is MUCH better than Christensen. College Algebra is a tough class, but she does a great job teaching it.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  Respected (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  Caring (2)  Tough Grader (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  EXTRA CREDIT
comments: Ms. Weston knows Calculus and enjoys teaching it. Her grading criteria are clear and her tests aren\'t easy, but she is fair and offers plenty of extra credit opportunity. Textbook is NOT used, but MyMathLab is used to submit all homework, with instant feedback and unlimited tries on each question.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  Respected (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  Caring (2)  Tough Grader (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  RESPECTED  CARING
comments: You have to work, but she is motivating and will go the extra mile to help anyone. Ms. Weston has a well rounded personality, and is the kind of teacher everyone in the room highly respects. If you want to understand calculus and get tons of real life applications for it, take her.

comments: Weston was ok. When it comes to her intro linear alg class, the vocab and terminology is Much harder and more confusing than the actual math operations. Her lecture can be a bit unclear, but not sure if its her or just linear alg. Seems like the class gets easier as you go along. She weeds out the slackers, then eases up... a little bit. got an A

comments: Reads lecture from powerpoint of the textbook itself, with little or no discussion or explanation. Sometimes refuses to answer well-formed questions from students. Enjoys making it harder than it really is. Unreasonably stingy with partial credit on exams. Practices "Gotcha" testing.

comments: Mrs. Weston is very nice, and she does mean well. She helped break down problems I didn\'t understand, but one thing is for sure you need to be on track with the schedule given and don\'t fall behind. Many of my classmates felt as though she wasn\'t friendly, but once you start talking to Mrs. Weston she is a very nice and intelligent person.

comments: She\'s very friendly and makes one feel at home. Here\'s the thing though: There\'s only so much she can help you with something like Math. If you can go home and review the chapter from the book and do just a few of the questions testing those concepts, you\'ll kill it. Most of her tests are MCQ tests! She also makes it a point to review all tests.
